page.title: 16Mr.Owen Sivell, Liskeard
page.content: Mr.Sivell,amply built and 6\ feet tall, has a deep booming voice to match his size;a figure well-known in the area.He came to Liskeard in May 1934 as a Police Constable and rose to become Chief Inspector in the now Devon and Cornwall Constabulary. His first impressions were of how clean and tidy the streets were and the number of people that attended the many chapels.The major changes he has seen have been the rise in the population, more public houses, more vandalism and more public services. He feels that there is more entertainment for the young today. In 1967 he became involved in local government and has been Mayor of Liskeard three times.He sees Liskeard as expanding and plans for the future include a new road from Callington,increased sports facilities for the young and a BMX track.
